SexGen seminar 29th April </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;8a0571a6.1503</link>   <description> \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdHi,<br><br>Please find attached and below details of the 9th Sexgen Seminar to be held in Hull in April.<br><br>Cheers,<br><br>Jo<br><br>SexGen Seminar<br>Gender and Intersectionality<br>Wednesday 29th April 2015, 1.30 - 6pm<br>University of Hull (venue tbc)<br><br>Professor Nira Yuval-Davis (via video link), University of East London, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdIntersectionality, inequality and domination\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>Dr. Stella Gonzalez Arnal, University of Hull \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdRethinking Intersectionality: Equal opportunities in Latin-American Higher Education institutions\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd.<br>Azeezat Johnson, University of Sheffield &quot;Researching \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdIntersectional\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Identities through clothing practices: the experiences of Black Muslim Women in Britain&quot;<br>Dr. Lucy Jones, University of Nottingham \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdIf a Muslim says \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdhomo\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, nothing gets Society' AAA 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;46c4c306.1503</link>   <description> - With apologies for cross-posting, please circulate to your lists -<br><br>Call for Papers: American Anthropological Association Meetings<br><br>Denver, CO, USA November 18-22nd 2015<br><br>Making parents: Assisted reproduction and parenting culture in contemporary society<br><br>Organisers: Dr Charlotte Faircloth (University of Roehampton) and Dr Zeynep Gurtin (University of Cambridge)<br><br>Panel Discussant: Professor Marcia Inhorn (Yale University) [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T11:07:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charlotte Faircloth</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;46c4c306.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;34da6198.1503">   <title>Atmospheres Conference, 1-2 July 2015, University of Manchester - REGISTRATION NOW OPEN </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;34da6198.1503</link>   <description> Registration is now open for our forthcoming Atmospheres Conference.<br><br>Atmospheres play a significant role in, and add an important quality to, our intimate, domestic and public lives, yet are often overlooked in social research, not least because of the methodological challenges involved in 'capturing' them.<br>In this major conference celebrating the 10th anniversary of the Morgan Centre, we will be using the theme of 'atmospheres' as our starting point for interdisciplinary dialogue. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-06T12:09:43+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Victoria Higham</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;34da6198.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;41281825.1503">   <title>CfP 'Emotional Methodologies' BSA Postgraduate Conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;41281825.1503</link>   <description> ++++Apologies for Cross-Posting++++<br><br>Hello,<br><br>Call for Papers<br>BSA Postgraduate Conference: 'Emotional Methodologies'<br>19 May 2015<br>University of Leicester<br><br>The conference ‘Emotional Methodologies' will explore methods for researching emotionally-charged data and reflections on researchers’ responses to them, focusing on two themes:<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd The methodological consequences of the affective turn in social science<br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd The move away from the idea of researcher as a detached observer towards more embedded and embodied presence [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-03T15:59:36+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Joseph.De-Lappe</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;41281825.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;969e9540.1503">   <title>FLaG CONFERENCE: Researching Relationships across Generations and through Time - 9 June, Leeds </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;969e9540.1503</link>   <description> We are delighted to announce a new conference organised by the Centre for Research into Families, the Life Course and Generations. A summary follows. Full details, and the registration form, can be downloaded from the FLaG website:<br>http://www.flag.leeds.ac.uk<br><br>We hope to welcome you to Leeds on 9th June.<br><br>Researching relationships across generations and through time [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-03T15:06:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sarah Irwin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;969e9540.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;eaac8232.1503">   <title>Reading group: The fantasy of the family in children's literature, with Dame Jacqueline Wilson, 26th March </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;eaac8232.1503</link>   <description> Dear all<br><br>We are delighted to invite you to the fourth meeting of our interdisciplinary reading group, with selections introduced by Dame Jacqueline Wilson (Chancellor, University of Roehampton) and Dr Lisa Sainsbury (Director, National Centre for Research in Children's Literature, University of Roehampton).<br>Hosted by Digby Stuart College - one of the oldest institutions for women's education in London - this is a twice-termly reading group for academics within and beyond the University of Roehampton with an interest in family, gender and feminism.<br>Reading: Chapter 1 of The Diamond Girls by Jacqueline Wilson (2004) and Conclusion of The Fantasy of [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-03T09:42:23+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charlotte Faircloth</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;eaac8232.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;1f7e470e.1503">   <title>Funded PhD studentship </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;1f7e470e.1503</link>   <description> Studentship Project Title: Social networks, social connectedness, and maternal mental health and well-being: the personal and social lives of vulnerable pregnant women when they are transitioning to motherhood and/or adapting to an additional child<br><br>This PhD will further the work being conducted as part of a realist evaluation for THRIVE http://www.sphsu.mrc.ac.uk/research-programmes/sh/fiho/thrive.html. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T11:17:03+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>O'Brien, Rosaleen</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;1f7e470e.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;3798683f.1502">   <title>Qualitative Longitudinal Research Methods Training Workshop - 8th June, Leeds University </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;3798683f.1502</link>   <description> Dear All,<br>The Centre for Research into Families, the Life Course and Generations (FLaG) is running a research methods training workshop on 8th June. Summary details are below, and full details, along with explanation of how to register, are available on the FLaG website: http://flag.leeds.ac.uk<br>The workshop costs \ufffd\ufffd40 to attend, but costs can be met for PhD students by Doctoral Training Centre funds \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd you just need follow the instructions provided on the website.<br>{Please be aware that we are also running a one day conference on the 9th June (Researching relationships across generations and through time); further details [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-26T14:49:50+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sarah Irwin</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;3798683f.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;210e67c4.1502">   <title>Join Us: 2015 Interdisciplinary Sex/Gender conference at UCLA (October 23-24, 2015) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;210e67c4.1502</link>   <description> A Critical Moment: Sex/Gender Research at the Intersection of Culture,<br>Brain, &amp; Behavior<br>WHEN: October 23-24, 2015 - Save the Date<br>WHERE: UCLA, Los Angeles, California<br><br>WEBSITES<br>http://www.thefpr.org/conference2015/<br>http://www.thefprconference2015.org &lt;http://www.thefprconference2015.org/&gt;<br><br>Be there when many of the world\ufffd\ufffds leading scholars from the Humanities and<br>Sciences discuss and debate issues at the intersection of sex/gender,<br>culture, brain, and behavior.<br>Great minds. Thrilling discussions. New connections. It\ufffd\ufffds all happening this<br>October 23-24, 2015 at UCLA. Join Us. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T11:29:49-08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mamie Wong</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;210e67c4.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item Woodiwiss, Senior Lecturer in Sociology, University of Huddersfield<br>j.woodiwiss@hud.ac.uk, 01484 472172    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T11:53:45+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jo rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;b1daff16.1502">   <title>East Midlands Medical Sociology Event May 11th 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;b1daff16.1502</link>   <description> Dear Colleague<br><br>Please see the attached advert (details outlined below) for an event being organised by the East Midlands Medical Sociology Group held at De Montfort University in May. Please feel free to share this advert within your networks.<br><br>Booking is essential, if you have any queries or would like to book a place, please don’t hesitate to get in touch. Further information will be sent out in due course. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-06T16:49:13+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jessica Davies</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;b1daff16.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;10ed58dd.1502">   <title>Sex, Power, and Slavery </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;10ed58dd.1502</link>   <description> Dear BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS subscribers,<br>We hope you find the following title of interest.<br><br>[9780821420973]Sex, Power, and Slavery<br>Edited by Gwyn Campbell and Elizabeth Elbourne<br>Sexual exploitation was and is a critical feature of enslavement. Across many different societies, slaves were considered to own neither their bodies nor their children, even if many struggled to resist. At the same time, paradoxes abound: for example, in some societies to bear the children of a master was a potential route to manumission for some women. Sex, Power, and Slavery is the first history of slavery and bondage to take sexuality seriously.<br>Twenty-six authors from [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-05T15:04:10+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charles Woodhead</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;10ed58dd.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;2bebd77f.1502">   <title>LGBT History Month - The series seeks to bring together academics across a range of disciplines with those involved in breastfeeding education, practice, activism, and policy. Our aim is to further understanding of women\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds embodied, affective and day-to-day practices in trying to breastfeed, and talk about how these experiences might be ameliorated. The seminars are being organised by the University of the West of England, Cardiff University and the University of South Wales. New<br>theories are utilizing a conception of the brain as dynamic, plastic, and<br>adaptable, and of sex/gender brain and behavioral differences as subject to<br>the influence of a broad range of biological, cultural, and social or<br>environmental factors. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-21T08:56:54-08:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mamie Wong</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;f93bfc3.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;978c4332.1501">   <title>Incest Avoidance and the Incest Taboos - Two Aspects of Human Nature </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS;978c4332.1501</link>   <description> Dear BSA-FAMILIES-AND-RELATIONSHIPS subscribers,<br><br>We hope you find this title of interest.<br><br>[Incest Avoidance and the Incest Taboos]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/incest-avoidance-and-the-incest-taboos&gt;Incest Avoidance and the Incest Taboos&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/incest-avoidance-and-the-incest-taboos&gt;<br><br>Two Aspects of Human Nature<br>Arthur Wolf<br>&quot;In this highly readable account of incest avoidance and taboos, Arthur Wolf explores fundamental questions about what it is to be human. In particular, he examines the articulation between our biological and our social/cultural natures, arriving at some brilliant insights along the way. Every student of anthropology should read this book.&quot;-Charles Stafford, London School of Economics<br>"Arthur Wolf has done it again.
